wikipedia_page.main: Chas Early is a British actor and playwright.  He has appeared on TV shows such as Casualty, EastEnders, Skins and Mayo. He is probably best known for portraying the late comedian Bill Hicks in his one-man show, Bill Hicks: Slight Return. In September 2021, he portrayed Andy Goddard in an episode of the BBC soap opera Doctors.

response: The British actor Chas Early portrayed Hicks in the one-man stage show Bill Hicks: Slight Return, which premiered in 2004. The show was co-written by Chas Early and Richard Hurst, and imagined Hicks's view of the world 10 years after his death.

He was a founding member of the sketch group The Four Horsemen, whose series This Is Pop! was broadcast on BBC Choice. His Edinburgh work has included work with Pegabovine and Girl and Dean, Moon The Loon (a play about Keith Moon), the sell-out children's shows Potted Potter, Potted Pirates, which he co-wrote, and Silly Billy Bum Breath. Potted Potter, which condenses all the Harry Potter novels into 80 minutes, has had two off-Broadway runs for a total of 30 weeks, and five West End runs. In 2004 he directed Bill Hicks: Slight Return, which he co-wrote with Chas Early. The play suggests what would happen if Bill Hicks returned to Earth for one final show. The show toured extensively in the UK, including four West End runs, and also appeared in Éire, Belgium and Australia. In 2010 he co-wrote and directed Potted Panto, which opened at the Pleasance Theatre, Edinburgh, and subsequently transferred to the Vaudeville Theatre, London, where it was nominated for an Olivier Award for Best Entertainment. It has also run for five seasons at the Southwark Playhouse, most recently in 2019–20.
*Other parts - Joseph Kloska, Gerard McDermott, Saikat Ahamed, Chas Early, Jon Glover, Christine Kavanagh, Bethan Walker, Sam Dale, Anna Wing, Mark Straker
